intro: Potentilla tormentilla subsp. divergens, commonly known as the alpine cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters, with woody stems and hairy leaves. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually divided into five oval-shaped lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and slopes.
